title: Augusta County: William L. Coan to Samuel Hunt, November 20, 1865
summary: Hardly obscuring his aggravation with the manner in which AMA administrators answered his calls for more teachers, Coan tersely asserts, "It is time I knew whether you design to supply." He states that he will be traveling to Washington, DC over the next couple of days and says he will look for a reply to his request there.
keywords: African Americans, Education, American Civil War
